alert.note: Alert for Eastern San Miguel County; Harding County; Northeast Highlands (New Mexico) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Albuquerque (Northern and Central New Mexico)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued May 26 at 11:59PM MDT by NWS Albuquerque
info.description: ...STRONG THUNDERSTORMS WILL IMPACT PORTIONS OF NORTHEASTERN SAN MIGUEL AND WEST CENTRAL HARDING COUNTIES THROUGH 1230 AM MDT... At 1158 PM MDT, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms along a line extending from 12 miles southwest of Solano to near Variadero. Movement was northeast at 15 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 50 mph and nickel size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Variadero, Trujillo, Trementina and Bell Ranch. This includes State Road 104 between Mile Markers 29 and 59. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.88 IN MAX WIND GUST...50 MPH
info.instruction: If threatening weather approaches your area, take shelter in a sturdy building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with these storms and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways.

area.areaDesc: Eastern San Miguel County; Harding County; Northeast Highlands
